    • constructRayThroughPixel

      public Ray constructRayThroughPixel​(int nX, int nY, int j, int i, double screenDistance, double screenWidth, double screenHeight)
      this function create a ray thrown from the camera through a center of a pixel
      Parameters:
      nX - = the number of the pixels on the X axis
      nY - = the number of the pixels on the Y axis
      j - = the position of the pixel on the Y anix
      i - = the position of the pixel on the X anix
      screenDistance - = the distance of the camera from the view plane
      screenWidth - = the width of the view plane
      screenHeight - = the height of the view plane
      Returns:
      ray thrown from the camera through a center of a pixel

    • constructRayBeamThroughPixel

      public static java.util.LinkedList<Ray> constructRayBeamThroughPixel​(Ray MainRay, Point3D p, double radiusRange, int numOfRays, Vector vup, Vector vright)
      this function calculate list of rays would construct from the intersected point to the light source position area
      Parameters:
      MainRay - the opposite vector to the ray constructed from the light source to the point intersected
      p - the starting point of the ray constructed from the light source to the point intersected
      radiusRange - the wanted range for creating rays
      numOfRays - the wanted num of rays need to be construct
      vup - vector of the camera axises
      vright - vector of the camera axises
      Returns:
      list of rays would construct from the intersected point to the light source position area
